intro: Jacquemontia anomala, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, round, green fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its rapid growth and distinctive appearance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
